channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Salt Bin, 4th January
item.description:
The salt bin outside 13 Finucane Drive is empty. Cars are slipping and sliding near corner of Finucane drive and Beamish Road and needs salt urgently especially as more snow is forecast.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finucane Drive, Ramsden, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light is still not working in Methuen Road(at the side of 18 Poplar Mounts housewall), 4th January
item.description:
This light in (Methuen Roads entrance, by 18 Poplar Mount side wall) was reported previously in the year by a neighbour as a broken light (as the light was hanging from the lampost as was not illuminating). This was replaced, but is now still not illuminating at all. This needs to be addressed as this part of the road is very dark, and feels unsafe when really dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: South side of Princess Road, 4th January
item.description:
There is a street light on the south side of Princess Road that has been out for months now with no fix by Brent council despite many other resident reports. Please fix ASAP
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Princess Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Canterbury Road, 4th January
item.description:
4 street lights are not working on this stretch of Canterbury Road and haven’t been for a number of months now despite numerous other reports from residents. Please get this basic public safety provision fixed ASAP. It shouldn’t take this many people to report this issue in order to get it fixed…what are we actually paying our council tax for…

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Delivery crates abandoned, 4th January
item.description:
Stack of plastic delivery crates (could be from a supermarket eg Sainsburys) flytipped on grass verge next to the fenced off park area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping blocking pathways, 4th January
item.description:
There is continuous fly tipping in this particular spot, which is getting worse. This has been a problem for over a year. The pavement pathways are regularly blocked by the fly tipping and rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodhill, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall along Elcot Avenue in unacceptable condition (graffiti tags sprayed everywhere), 4th January
item.description:
Under the new council powers please remove the graffiti from this wall at the top of Elcot Avenue. It is totally unacceptable that local residents have to live in conditions like this. Just cover with paint as soon as possible. Thank you. https://southwarknews.co.uk/area/peckham/graffiti-stricken-private-property-owners-to-get-free-clean-up-service-from-southwark-council/ .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 244, Commercial Way, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

At Tillingham Way entrance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tillingham Way, Woodside Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping a constant issue, 4th January
item.description:
Stuff is always left here along the park railing. It's a continuous issue. Surely a CCTV camera should be installed to prevent people doing it and getting away with it. Common sense.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Park Lane, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy road and pavement Lansdowne Road N3 1ET, 4th January
item.description:
Lansdowne Road N3 1ET is on a hill just off the busy Nether Street. With all the school time road closures and roadworks locally there is increased traffic on Nether Street and people use Lansdowne Road as a way to try to avoid Nether Street. With the weather being as it is, Lansdowne Road is a sheet of ice at the moment, especially at the top where it meets Nether Street. Lansdowne Road doesn't get gritted when Nether Street is. The pavement is also hazardous, and the 326 stops up there. Could you grit Lansdowne Road, and add in extra grit bins (or replace the one removed at the bottom of the road)?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Lansdowne Road, West Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
